      • enableOrthoMode

        public void enableOrthoMode(boolean enable)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderer
        Controls whether the renderer is in orthographic or perspective mode. If ortho mode is enabled when IRenderer.processRenderQueue() is invoked, all SceneNodes in the render queue are drawn using orthographic projection. If ortho mode is disabled (the default) then SceneNodes are drawn using the perpective projection defined by the renderer's current ICamera settings (except that SceneNodes which have have had their SceneNode.RENDER_MODE explicitly set to SceneNode.RENDER_MODE.ORTHO are still rendered in orthographic mode).
        Specified by:
        enableOrthoMode in interface IRenderer
        Parameters:
        enable - - enables orthographic projection rendering for all queued SceneNodes if true; otherwise, only SceneNodes with RENDER_MODE = ORTHO are rendered in orthographic form

      • isInOrthoMode

        public boolean isInOrthoMode()
        Description copied from interface: IRenderer
        Returns whether or not the renderer is currently in orthographic rendering mode.
        Specified by:
        isInOrthoMode in interface IRenderer
        Returns:
        true if the renderer is in orthographic mode, else false

      • init

        public void init()
        Originally this was invoked through the GLAutoDrawable "callback"; now it is invoked locally as needed for "active rendering".

      • isRealized

        public boolean isRealized()
        Description copied from interface: IRenderer
        Returns true if the renderer is fully constructed and ready to be used. This method is necessary due to the multi-threaded nature of the interface between IRenderers and the underlying graphics system; successful return from an IRenderer implementation constructor does not necessarily insure that the underlying graphics system has completed the renderer construction. Applications constructing a renderer should invoke this method to determine whether the renderer is fully constructed ("realized") before using the renderer.
        Specified by:
        isRealized in interface IRenderer
        Returns:
        true if the renderer implementation is ready for use

        The renderer's implementation of drawing a TriMesh object. Every renderer must implement each of the draw() methods specified in the IRenderer interface.
        Specified by:

      • setRenderMethod

        public void setRenderMethod(IRenderer.RENDER_METHOD renderMethod)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderer
        Provides a hint to the renderer regarding the preferred rendering method on the underlying hardware. Note that since not all hardware nor all IRenderer implementations support all rendering methods, setting the renderer's IRenderer.RENDER_METHOD should be considered advisory.
        Specified by:
        setRenderMethod in interface IRenderer
        Parameters:
        renderMethod - - the preferred rendering method the renderer should use if the hardware supports it

      • createRenderState

        public RenderState createRenderState(RenderState.RenderStateType type)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderer
        Creates a RenderState object of the specified type. Each IRenderer implementation is responsible for implementing this factory method in an implementation-dependent way and such that it can return any of the RenderStates defined by RenderState.RenderStateType.
        Specified by:
        createRenderState in interface IRenderer

        Returns:

      • swapBuffers

        public void swapBuffers()
        Description copied from interface: IRenderer
        Instructs this IRenderer to swap its front and back buffers, causing the content of the back buffer to be displayed. Note that some IRenderer implementations perform automatic buffer swapping at the completion of a call to IRenderer.processRenderQueue(); this method should not be invoked on such IRenderer implementations unless the implementation has first had auto-swapping turned off via a call to IRenderer.setAutoSwapEnabled(boolean) with false.
        Specified by:
        swapBuffers in interface IRenderer

      • setAutoSwapEnabled

        public void setAutoSwapEnabled(boolean onOff)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderer
        Instructs the IRenderer implementation to enable or disable automatic back-buffer swapping at the completion of an IRenderer.processRenderQueue() invocation. IRenderer implementations may (but are not required to) implement automatic buffer swapping at the completion of IRenderer.processRenderQueue() when their autoswap enabled flag is true.
        Specified by:
        setAutoSwapEnabled in interface IRenderer
        Parameters:
        onOff - - the new value of the IRenderer's autoswap enabled flag
